result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel L Thoreson Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes:
While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806
All financial obligations are placed on a payment plan. Defendant is to pay $50 per month beginning 5/6/16

Def to obtain domestic abuse/perpetrators counseling as directed and complete recommendations.
  The Def is to obtain a psych evaluation and complete recommended treatment.

The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
NO CONTACT WITH K.B.
  Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed!
Contact a Veteran's Service Office at least 2 times per month.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

judgments.dispoDesc: Probation is revoked and sentence is imposed.
judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is granted credit for time served in the amount of 215 days  as calculated by the Ashland County Sheriff's Department
Concurrent with: Count 3 in 15CF195, 15CF84, 15CF219 and Bayfield County case 15CM154
All financial obligations previously ordered are now a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel L Thoreson Jr.

records.descr: Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel L Thoreson in court with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  15CF84,15CF195,15CF219. Revocation and summary was filed to the Court.  State comments-- There are date errors on the revocation and summary-- Page 1-- needs to be changed to 2018 in paragraph 1 and 2. Summary of cases on page 5- missed numbered case numbers. Def has a history of criminal behavorial., no violent felonys. Non Compliant of Court orders by the number of bail jumping cases. Def has a addiction problem. Ct has an opportunity to send him to prison. States comments on recommendation- Probation was revoked in Byfld Co case- 319 days total days credit. Atty comments on recommendation-- Atty has been the def's atty since 2013-- 190% disabled Vet. Def has a substance abuse problem. Def had left the area and went to California -- WI does not have enough programs for Vets. Atty is asking for the Court to follow the recommendation from DOC and not the State. Asking for 9 months that runs concurrent to all counts. State comments on case-- State disagrees with the DOC recommendation. 2011- was when he was released from duty. Def makes comments on case. Ct comments on case.


Ct orders- the recommendation of DOC. 


 15CF195-- 9 months jail on both counts , concurrent with each other and concurrent with Byfld Co

15CF84-- 9 months jail both counts run concurrent  on all counts and cases

15CF219-- 9 months count 1 and 30 days count 2 to run concurrent with all counts and cases. 

 Credit for 215 days on Byfld Co case-- Stip -- 215 days for credit. 
Put in the JOC -- Credit for time served. 

Civil Judgment on any financial obligations.

Defendant Daniel L Thoreson in court with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA- Agreement, plea to following counts: 15CF84 amend to ct 1 to Mids. BJ as repeater and ct 5 resist repeater. 15CF195 amned to BJ Misd and ct 3  15CF219 amend ct 1 to misd bj repeater and ct 2 any remaining counts/charges DRI. Rec WH sent 2yrs prob 8mo jail (15CF84) each count concurrent, NC Kateri Bender, NO MAS, not present where MAS,  pshy eval , AODA, DV perp counceling, meet 2x monthly with co vet serv officer, $10 fine plus costs each count, DNA sample.  Plea NC to all 6 counts.  Admits repeater, Ct3 15CF195 act of domest abuse. 15CF84 Ct2,3,4 15CF195 Ct 2,4,5 are read in and dismissed. 
Ct accepts pleas and finds def Guilty. All convictions as repeater. 15CF84 BJ misd, and resisting  15CF195 BJ misd, Battery mids-domestic  15CF219 BJ misd 946.49(1)(a) and possession THC. State has complied with vic rights (nothing to provide). 69 days Credit for time served per DA. 
Each Ct sent WH prob 2 years. Serve 240 days jail as condition of probation on Ct 1 15CF84 69 days credit. Report DOC with in 24hrs contact ACJ w/in 10days begin serving no later 5/15/16 9am. NC Kateri Bender, RX as prescribed, Abs Sob, not present where MAS consumed, pshyc eval and follow through, DV counceling, 2x per month visit Vet services office, DNA spec, $10 fine misd on all bj $488.88, on resisting $488.88, battery $593.88, possession $498.80. Contraband forfeited. $50 per month to COC 5/6/16
